  1: <?php
  2: 
  3: namespace Instagram\Http\Clients;
  4: 
  5: use Instagram\Http\Response;
  6: 
  7: /**
  8:  * Instagram mock client class.
  9:  *
 10:  * @package    Instagram
 11:  * @author     Hassan Khan <contact@hassankhan.me>
 12:  * @link       https://github.com/hassankhan/instagram-sdk
 13:  * @license    MIT
 14:  */
 15: final class MockAdapter implements AdapterInterface
 16: {
 17:     /**
 18:      * @var string
 19:      */
 20:     protected $fixturesPath;
 21: 
 22:     /**
 23:      * Creates a new instance of `MockAdapter`.
 24:      *
 25:      * @param string $fixturesPath
 26:      */
 27:     public function __construct($fixturesPath)
 28:     {
 29:         $this->fixturesPath = rtrim($fixturesPath, '/').'/';
 30:     }
 31: 
 32:     /**
 33:      * {@inheritDoc}
 34:      */
 35:     public function request($method, $uri, array $parameters = [])
 36:     {
 37:         $file = file_get_contents($this->mapRequestToFile($method, $uri, $parameters));
 38:         return Response::createFromJson(json_decode($file, true));
 39:     }
 40: 
 41:     /**
 42:      * Parse the correct filename from the request.
 43:      *
 44:      * @param string $method
 45:      * @param string $uri
 46:      * @param array  $parameters
 47:      *
 48:      * @return string
 49:      */
 50:     protected function mapRequestToFile($method, $uri, $parameters)
 51:     {
 52:         $filename  = strtolower($method).'_';
 53:         $filename .= $this->cleanPath($uri);
 54:         $suffix    = $this->mapRequestParameters($parameters);
 55:         return $this->fixturesPath.$filename.$suffix.'.json';
 56:     }
 57: 
 58:     protected function cleanPath($uri)
 59:     {
 60:         $urlPath   = parse_url($uri, PHP_URL_PATH);
 61:         $uri       = str_replace('v1/', '', $urlPath);
 62:         $path      = preg_replace('/(\/\w{10}$|self|\d*)/', '', $uri);
 63:         return trim(preg_replace('/\/{1,2}|\-/', '_', $path), '_');
 64:     }
 65: 
 66:     /**
 67:      * Parses any filename properties from the request parameters.
 68:      *
 69:      * @param $parameters
 70:      *
 71:      * @return string
 72:      */
 73:     protected function mapRequestParameters($parameters)
 74:     {
 75:         if (empty($parameters) || !array_key_exists('query', $parameters)) {
 76:             return '';
 77:         }
 78: 
 79:         $exclude = [
 80:             'q',
 81:             'count',
 82:             'min_id',
 83:             'max_id',
 84:             'min_tag_id',
 85:             'max_tag_id',
 86:             'lat',
 87:             'lng',
 88:             'distance',
 89:             'text',
 90:             'max_like_id',
 91:             'action',
 92:             'cursor',
 93:             'access_token',
 94:         ];
 95: 
 96:         $modifiers = array_except($parameters['query'], $exclude);
 97:         $return    = implode('_', array_keys($modifiers));
 98:         return rtrim("_".$return, '_');
 99:     }
100: 
101:     /**
102:      * {@inheritDoc}
103:      */
104:     public function paginate(Response $response, $limit = null)
105:     {
106:         // If there's nothing to paginate, return response as-is
107:         if (!$response->hasPages() || $limit === 0) {
108:             return $response;
109:         }
110: 
111:         $next   = $this->request('GET', $response->nextUrl());
112:         $merged = $response->merge($next);
113: 
114:         // If `$limit` is not set then call itself indefinitely
115:         if ($limit === null) {
116:             return $this->paginate($merged);
117:         }
118: 
119:         // If `$limit` is set, call itself while decrementing it each time
120:         $limit--;
121:         return $this->paginate($merged, $limit);
122:     }
123: }
